Problem:
Consider a complex function defined as \\( z(t) = e^{iAt}x \\), where \\( A \\) is a constant matrix and \\( x \\) is a constant vector in complex space. This function is used to transform an initial vector in a complex vector space. We investigate the influence of applying an additional transformation \\( g(z) = e^{Dt}z \\) at a time t, where \\( D \\) is also a constant matrix.

If an intervention with the function \\( g(z) = e^{Dt}z \\) is introduced at some time \\( t_1 \\), will the resultant state at time \\( T \\) where \\( T > t_1 \\) depend solely on the matrix \\( A \\) and not \\( D \\)?
Explanation: The intervention modifies the mechanism governing the state evolution initially set by \\( A \\). Post-intervention, the new influence of \\( D \\) will interact with the effects of \\( A \\), affecting the trajectory and thereby the final state at time \\( T \\). Hence, both \\( A \\) and \\( D \\) will dictate the outcome.
